Controllers

The controllers package contains business logic that processes requests from views and interacts with models and services. Controllers follow snake_case naming for methods as per Python conventions.

Authentication Controller

Authentication controller for the BusFlow application.

This module provides the AuthController class that handles all authentication-related business logic including login, registration, and session management.

module:

app.controllers.auth_controller

class app.controllers.auth_controller.AuthController[source]

Bases: object

Controller for handling authentication operations.

This controller manages user login, registration, and role validation. It acts as an intermediary between the auth views and the Supabase service.

Example:

controller = AuthController()
user, error = controller.login('user@example.com', 'password', 'user')
__init__()[source]

Initialize the AuthController with a Supabase service instance.

login(email, password, portal_type)[source]

Authenticate a user and validate their role matches the portal.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s email address

  • password (str) – User’s password

  • portal_type (str) – Type of portal (user, driver, admin)

Returns:

Tuple of (User object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

Example:

user, error = controller.login('user@test.com', 'pass123', 'user')
if error:
    print(f"Login failed: {error}")
else:
    print(f"Welcome, {user.name}")
register(name, email, password)[source]

Register a new user account (passengers only).

Only regular users can self-register. Drivers must be created by admins.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – User’s full name

  • email (str) – User’s email address

  • password (str) – User’s chosen password

Returns:

Tuple of (User object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

Example:

user, error = controller.register('John Doe', 'john@test.com', 'pass123')
logout()[source]

Log out the current user.

get_user_by_id(user_id)[source]

Fetch a user by their ID.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – UUID of the user

Returns:

User object or None

Return type:

User or None

Bus Controller

Bus controller for the BusFlow application.

This module provides the BusController class that handles all bus-related business logic including fetching, creating, updating, and managing bus assignments.

module:

app.controllers.bus_controller

class app.controllers.bus_controller.BusController[source]

Bases: object

Controller for handling bus operations.

This controller manages all bus-related functionality including fleet management, route searching, and driver assignments.

Example:

controller = BusController()
buses = controller.get_all_buses()
__init__()[source]

Initialize the BusController with a Supabase service instance.

get_all_buses()[source]

Fetch all buses in the fleet.

Returns:

List of Bus objects

Return type:

list

get_bus_by_id(bus_id)[source]

Fetch a specific bus by its ID.

Parameters:

bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

Returns:

Bus object or None

Return type:

Bus or None

get_buses_for_driver(driver_id)[source]

Fetch all buses assigned to a specific driver.

Parameters:

driver_id (str) – UUID of the driver

Returns:

List of Bus objects

Return type:

list

get_active_buses()[source]

Fetch all active buses available for booking.

Returns:

List of active Bus objects

Return type:

list

search_buses(source, destination)[source]

Search for buses that travel from source to destination.

Returns only active buses where the source stop comes before the destination stop in the route.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – Name of the boarding stop

  • destination (str) – Name of the destination stop

Returns:

List of matching Bus objects

Return type:

list

Example:

buses = controller.search_buses('Uttara', 'Motijheel')
create_bus(name, route, price, driver_id=None, status='ACTIVE')[source]

Create a new bus in the fleet.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Display name of the bus

  • route (list) – List of stops in order

  • price (int) – Ticket price in BDT

  • driver_id (str or None) – UUID of assigned driver (optional)

  • status (str) – Operational status

Returns:

Tuple of (Bus object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

update_bus(bus_id, name, route, price, driver_id=None, status='ACTIVE')[source]

Update an existing bus.

Parameters:

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus to update

  • name (str) – New display name

  • route (list) – New route list

  • price (int) – New ticket price

  • driver_id (str or None) – New driver assignment

  • status (str) – New operational status

Returns:

Tuple of (Bus object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

assign_driver(bus_id, driver_id)[source]

Assign a driver to a bus.

Parameters:

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

  • driver_id (str) – UUID of the driver

Returns:

Tuple of (success boolean, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

get_unassigned_buses()[source]

Fetch all buses without assigned drivers.

Returns:

List of Bus objects without drivers

Return type:

list

get_bus_with_driver_info()[source]

Fetch all buses with their driver information.

Returns:

List of dictionaries with bus and driver data

Return type:

list

Booking Controller

Booking controller for the BusFlow application.

This module provides the BookingController class that handles all booking-related business logic including creating bookings, fetching user tickets, seat availability, and cancellations.

module:

app.controllers.booking_controller

class app.controllers.booking_controller.BookingController[source]

Bases: object

Controller for handling booking operations.

This controller manages all ticket booking functionality including creating bookings, cancelling tickets, and checking seat availability.

Example:

controller = BookingController()
bookings = controller.get_user_bookings(user_id)
__init__()[source]

Initialize the BookingController with a Supabase service instance.

get_user_bookings(user_id)[source]

Fetch all bookings for a specific user.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – UUID of the user

Returns:

List of Booking objects

Return type:

list

get_confirmed_bookings(user_id)[source]

Fetch only confirmed bookings for a user.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – UUID of the user

Returns:

List of confirmed Booking objects

Return type:

list

get_occupied_seats(bus_id, date_str=None)[source]

Get list of occupied seat numbers for a bus on a date.

Parameters:

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

  • date_str (str or None) – Date string (defaults to today)

Returns:

List of occupied seat numbers

Return type:

list

get_seat_layout(bus_id, date_str=None)[source]

Get the seat layout with availability status.

Returns a list of seat objects with seat number and availability.

Parameters:

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

  • date_str (str or None) – Date string (defaults to today)

Returns:

List of seat dictionaries

Return type:

list

Example:

seats = controller.get_seat_layout(bus_id)
for seat in seats:
    print(f"{seat['number']}: {'Occupied' if seat['isOccupied'] else 'Available'}")
create_booking(user_id, bus_id, seat_number, source, destination, price)[source]

Create a single seat booking.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – UUID of the user making the booking

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

  • seat_number (str) – Seat label to book

  • source (str) – Boarding stop name

  • destination (str) – Destination stop name

  • price (int) – Ticket price

Returns:

Tuple of (Booking object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

create_multiple_bookings(user_id, bus_id, seat_numbers, source, destination, price_per_seat)[source]

Create bookings for multiple seats.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – UUID of the user

  • bus_id (str) – UUID of the bus

  • seat_numbers (list) – List of seat labels to book

  • source (str) – Boarding stop name

  • destination (str) – Destination stop name

  • price_per_seat (int) – Price per ticket

Returns:

Tuple of (list of Booking objects, list of error messages)

Return type:

tuple

cancel_booking(booking_id, user_id)[source]

Cancel a booking (soft delete).

Parameters:

  • booking_id (str) – UUID of the booking

  • user_id (str) – UUID of the user (for verification)

Returns:

Tuple of (success boolean, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

delete_booking(booking_id, user_id)[source]

Permanently delete a booking.

Parameters:

  • booking_id (str) – UUID of the booking

  • user_id (str) – UUID of the user (for verification)

Returns:

Tuple of (success boolean, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

get_booking_with_bus(user_id)[source]

Fetch user bookings with associated bus information.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – UUID of the user

Returns:

List of dictionaries with booking and bus data

Return type:

list

User Controller

User controller for the BusFlow application.

This module provides the UserController class that handles user management operations performed by administrators.

module:

app.controllers.user_controller

class app.controllers.user_controller.UserController[source]

Bases: object

Controller for handling user management operations.

This controller is primarily used by administrators to manage users and create driver accounts.

Example:

controller = UserController()
drivers = controller.get_all_drivers()
__init__()[source]

Initialize the UserController with a Supabase service instance.

get_all_users()[source]

Fetch all users in the system.

Returns:

List of User objects

Return type:

list

get_all_drivers()[source]

Fetch all users with driver role.

Returns:

List of User objects with driver role

Return type:

list

get_all_passengers()[source]

Fetch all users with regular user role.

Returns:

List of User objects with user role

Return type:

list

get_user_by_id(user_id)[source]

Fetch a specific user by their ID.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – UUID of the user

Returns:

User object or None

Return type:

User or None

create_driver(name, email, password)[source]

Create a new driver account.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Driver’s full name

  • email (str) – Driver’s email address

  • password (str) – Initial password

Returns:

Tuple of (User object or None, error message or None)

Return type:

tuple

Example:

driver, error = controller.create_driver('John Driver', 'john@test.com', 'pass123')
get_users_by_role(role)[source]

Fetch all users with a specific role.

Parameters:

role (str) – Role to filter by (USER, DRIVER, ADMIN)

Returns:

List of User objects

Return type:

list

get_user_statistics()[source]

Get statistics about users in the system.

Returns:

Dictionary with user count statistics

Return type:

dict
